text: Wonderful, Wonderful is a 1957 studio album by Johnny Mathis. It was released on 8 July, 1957 through Columbia Records and went to number 4 in the United States. ==Track listing== ===Side one=== #"Will I Find My Love Today?" (Alex Fogarty, Sydney Shaw) – 3:32 #"Looking at You" (Cole Porter) – 2:16 #"Let Me Love You" (Bart Howard) – 3:47 #"All Through the Night" from Anything Goes (Porter) – 2:56 #"It Could Happen to You" from And the Angels Sing (Johnny Burke, Jimmy Van Heusen) – 3:47 #"That Old Black Magic" (Harold Arlen, Johnny Mercer) – 2:51 ===Side two=== #"Too Close for Comfort" from Mr. Wonderful (Jerry Bock, George David Weiss, Larry Holofcener) – 2:34 #"In the Wee Small Hours of the Morning" (David Mann, Bob Hilliard) – 3:13 #"Year After Year" (Howard) – 3:12 #"Early Autumn" (Ralph Burns, Woody Herman, Johnny Mercer) – 3:38 #"You Stepped Out of a Dream" from Ziegfeld Girl (Nacio Herb Brown, Gus Kahn) – 2:44 #"Day In, Day Out" (Rube Bloom, Mercer) – 2:08 ==References== Category:1950s albums Category:Johnny Mathis albums Category:Columbia Records albums
title: Wonderful, Wonderful (Johnny Mathis album)
